OVERVIEW: The Kiln series consists of shallow, well drained soils that formed in material derived from limestone.  Kiln soils are on uplands, ridges and mountains and have slopes of 3 to 40 percent.  Mean annual precipitation is about 18 inches.  The mean annual air temperature is about 45 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy, mixed, superactive, frigid Lithic Argiustolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Kiln stony loam - forest.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated)
01--1 inch to 0; raw and partially decomposed pine needle and oak leaf litter.
A1--0 to 5 inches; brown (7.5YR 4/4) stony loam, dark brown (7.5YR 3/2) moist; weak thin platy structure parting to weak very fine granular; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 30 percent stones and pebbles; many fine and very fine roots; few fine pores; mildly alkaline (pH 7.5); clear smooth boundary.  (3 to 5 inches thick)
B2t--5 to 10 inches; reddish brown (5YR 5/3) stony clay loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, firm, sticky and plastic; common thin continuous clay films on faces of peds; about 30 percent stones; common fine and medium roots; few fine pores; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); abrupt clear boundary.  (4 to 15 inches thick)
R--10 inches; extremely hard, dense limestone.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  McKinley County, New Mexico; about 2 1/2 miles south of McGaffey in NE1/4 sec. 21, T. 13 N., R. 16 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Thickness of solum and depth to bedrock range from 7 to 20 inches.  Rock fragments comprise 10 to 35 percent of the solum.  The solum is neutral or mildly alkaline.
The A horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 3 through 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 3 or 4 dry and 2 or 3 moist.  It is stony loam, stony silt loam or stony clay loam.
The B horizon has hue of 7.5YR or 5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 3 through 5 moist, and chroma of 2 through 4.  It is stony or cobbly silty clay loam or clay loam.  In some pedons the rock fragments are coated with lime on the under side.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Beenom, Coni and Hauser series in the same family and the Chilson series.  Beenom soils are underlain by sandstone and have 10YR hue.  Coni soils are slightly acid throughout.  Chilson soils are clayey.  Hauser soils contain free carbonates at depths of 6 to 10 inches.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  These soils are on gently to steeply sloping uplands at elevations of 7,000 to 9,000 feet.  They formed in material derived from limestone.  The climate is semiarid continental with a mean annual precipitation of 15 to 20 inches, a mean annual temperature of 42 to 47 degrees F. and frost-free season of 120 to 140 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Dargol, Fuera, and Stout soils.  Dargol soils are in a fine family and are underlain by shale and sandstone.  Fuera soils are in a fine family and lack bedrock within depth of 20 inches.  Stout soils lack an argillic horizon.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; slow to medium runoff; and moderate permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Multiple use for timber production, wildlife, summer and fall livestock range.  Vegetation is ponderosa pine, alligator juniper, pinyon pine, Gambel oak, with an understory of Oregon grape, blue grama, lupine, Arizona fescue, squirreltail grass, mountain muhly, muttongrass, sideoats grama, and little bluestem.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  North-central New Mexico.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Zuni Mountains Area, New Mexico 1964.
OSED scanned by SSQA.  Last revised by state on 7/77.

HORIZONS.name: A1
HORIZONS.narrative: A1--0 to 5 inches; brown (7.5YR 4/4) stony loam, dark brown (7.5YR 3/2) moist; weak thin platy structure parting to weak very fine granular; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 30 percent stones and pebbles; many fine and very fine roots; few fine pores; mildly alkaline (pH 7.5); clear smooth boundary.  (3 to 5 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: B2t
HORIZONS.narrative: B2t--5 to 10 inches; reddish brown (5YR 5/3) stony clay loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, firm, sticky and plastic; common thin continuous clay films on faces of peds; about 30 percent stones; common fine and medium roots; few fine pores; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); abrupt clear boundary.  (4 to 15 inches thick)
01--1 inch to 0; raw and partially decomposed pine needle and oak leaf litter.

HORIZONS.name: R
HORIZONS.narrative: R--10 inches; extremely hard, dense limestone.
